hints.title: Effective Temperature at QSD
hints.content:
356: :label: conj-effective-temperature-qsd
357: 
358: At the QSD, the effective temperature satisfies a modified fluctuation-dissipation relation:
359: 
360: $$
361: k_B T_{\text{eff}} = \frac{m\sigma_v^2}{2(\gamma + \gamma_{\text{clone}})}
362: $$
363: 
364: where:
365: 
366: $$
367: \gamma_{\text{clone}} = \frac{(1 - \alpha_{\text{rest}}^2)}{\tau_{\text{clone}}} \langle n_{\text{collision}} \rangle
368: $$
369: 
370: and $\langle n_{\text{collision}} \rangle$ is the average number of walkers per collision group.
371: 
372: **Justification**: Both Langevin friction ($\gamma$) and cloning dissipation ($\gamma_{\text{clone}}$) act to reduce velocity variance. At equilibrium, they combine additively to give an effective friction.
373: 
374: **Status**: This is a **conjecture** requiring verification by:
375: 1. Solving the full Fokker-Planck equation at QSD
376: 2. Computing $\langle n_{\text{collision}} \rangle$ from the birth-death process
